page.title: 16A SPAXTON FARMERS DAY
page.content: The alarm clock goes and the farmer wakes up at six aclock. He goes and gathers up his cows and takes them to the milking parlour he puts the cups on the cows teats and turns on the switch and it begins to milk the cows. when it finishes the farmer puts the cows back into the field and then washes the milking parlour. Next he feeds his cows and does a few odd jobs. Then he has his breakfast and a cup of tea at about nine aclock. After that if it is spring the farmer gets in his tractor and ploughs two acres and sows a field of peas. By that time it is time for lunch. He has his lunch and then has a look at his crops and then he goes into town to get some animal feed for the pigs. He comes back for milking time again. The milk tanker comes and gets the milk. He has his tea, checks his stock, bed at 10pm
